metadata.Title: CVE-2021-34981 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: [Bluetooth CMTP Module Double Free Privilege Escalation Vulnerability]

notes.Note: cascardo> to exploit this requires CAP_NET_ADMIN in the init namespace (init_ns): cmtp_add_connection is called from do_cmtp_sock_ioctl, with command CMTPCONNADD, which checks for capable(CAP_NET_ADMIN).

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
